Mexican.cooking_instructions: Marinate pork with achiote paste, orange juice, vinegar, and spices for 2 hours. Cook on grill or skillet until done. Warm tortillas. Serve pork with pineapple, cilantro, onion, and lime wedges.

Toast chiles and remove seeds. Toast nuts and seeds. Sauté onion and garlic. Blend all ingredients except chicken. Cook sauce for 2 hours. Add chicken and simmer for 1 hour. Serve with rice and tortillas.

Boil tomatillos and jalapeños. Blend with onion, garlic, cilantro, and salt. Fry tortillas briefly. Fill with chicken and roll. Place in baking dish. Cover with sauce and cheese. Bake at 350°F for 20 minutes. Serve with sour cream.

Cook pork and hominy in water for 2 hours. Toast chiles and blend with garlic, onion, and spices. Add to pot and simmer for 30 minutes. Shred pork. Serve with cabbage, onion, radishes, lime, and oregano.

Roast peppers and remove skins. Make filling with beef, onion, garlic, and spices. Stuff peppers. Beat egg whites until stiff. Fold in yolks and flour. Dip peppers in batter and fry until golden. Serve with tomato sauce.
Beat lard until fluffy. Mix masa with salt and baking powder. Add stock gradually. Beat into lard. Spread masa on husks. Add chicken and sauce. Fold and steam for 1 hour. Serve with salsa.
Mash avocados with lime juice and salt. Mix in remaining ingredients. Adjust seasoning. Serve immediately with tortilla chips.
Boil water, butter, and salt. Add flour and stir until smooth. Beat in eggs one at a time. Pipe into hot oil and fry until golden. Roll in cinnamon sugar. Serve with chocolate sauce.
Marinate fish in lime juice for 30 minutes. Add shrimp, vegetables, and seasonings. Mix well and chill for 1 hour. Serve with avocado and tortilla chips.
Caramelize sugar in ramekins. Beat eggs with milks, vanilla, and salt. Pour over caramel. Bake in water bath at 350°F for 45 minutes. Chill for 4 hours. Invert and serve.

ingredients: 3 lbs pork shoulder, cut into chunks
Mexican.cooking_instructions: Marinate pork with citrus juices, garlic, and spices for 2 hours. Cook in lard until tender and crispy. Shred meat. Serve on tortillas with salsa, cilantro, and onion.

ingredients: Salsa and sour cream for serving
Mexican.cooking_instructions: Heat oil in skillet. Place tortilla and add cheese, chicken, and vegetables. Top with another tortilla. Cook until golden and cheese melts. Flip and cook other side. Cut into wedges and serve with salsa and sour cream.
Fry tortilla strips until crispy. Blend tomatoes, onion, garlic, and chipotles. Cook in stock with spices for 20 minutes. Add tortilla strips. Serve with avocado, cheese, and cilantro.
Grill corn until charred. Mix mayonnaise, sour cream, and lime juice. Brush corn with mixture. Sprinkle with cheese, spices, and cilantro. Serve immediately.
Soak rice, almonds, and cinnamon in water overnight. Blend until smooth. Strain through cheesecloth. Add sugar and vanilla. Chill for 2 hours. Serve over ice with cinnamon garnish.

Bake cake with flour, baking powder, butter, sugar, eggs, and vanilla. Mix three milks. Poke holes in cake and pour milk mixture. Chill for 4 hours. Whip cream with sugar and vanilla. Frost cake and serve.

ingredients: 3 lbs goat or beef, cut into chunks
Mexican.cooking_instructions: Toast chiles and remove seeds. Blend with vegetables, vinegar, and spices. Marinate meat for 2 hours. Cook in Dutch oven for 3 hours until tender. Shred meat. Serve in tortillas with onion, cilantro, and lime.

ingredients: 4 cups fresh fruit (watermelon, cantaloupe, or mango)
Mexican.cooking_instructions: Blend fruit with water, sugar, and lime juice. Strain through fine mesh. Chill for 1 hour. Serve over ice with mint garnish.
Make churros as usual. Heat cajeta until warm. Drizzle over churros and sprinkle with pecans. Serve immediately.
Mix all ingredients in bowl. Let sit for 30 minutes to blend flavors. Serve with tortilla chips or as topping for tacos.

ingredients: Sour cream and guacamole for serving
Mexican.cooking_instructions: Heat butter in pan. Place tortilla, add cheese, chicken, and salsa. Top with second tortilla. Cook for 2-3 minutes per side until golden and cheese melts. Cut into wedges. Serve with sour cream and guacamole.
Mash avocados with lime juice. Mix in onion, tomatoes, jalapeño, cilantro, and salt. Serve immediately with tortilla chips.
Heat oil and cook onion until soft. Add garlic and rice. Cook for 2 minutes. Add tomatoes, broth, and spices. Bring to boil, then simmer for 15 minutes. Season with salt.

Season fish with cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper. Cook fish for 3-4 minutes per side. Warm tortillas. Mix sour cream with lime juice. Assemble tacos with fish, cabbage, and sour cream mixture. Garnish with cilantro.
Grill corn until charred. Mix mayonnaise and sour cream. Brush corn with mixture. Sprinkle with cheese, chili powder, and lime juice. Garnish with cilantro.

ingredients: Toppings: lettuce, tomato, cheese, sour cream
Mexican.cooking_instructions: Season chicken with cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper. Cook chicken with onion and garlic for 5 minutes. Add lime juice. Warm tortillas. Serve chicken with desired toppings.
Heat refried beans. Layer in dish with sour cream, salsa, and cheese. Microwave until cheese melts. Top with green onions. Serve with tortilla chips.
Marinate fish in lime juice for 10 minutes. Add onion, jalapeños, cilantro, and salt. Mix well. Serve with tortilla chips.
Cook chorizo until browned. Add hash browns and cook until crispy. Scramble eggs with salt and pepper. Warm tortillas. Fill with chorizo mixture, eggs, cheese, and salsa. Roll and serve.
Boil tomatillos and jalapeños for 5 minutes. Blend with onion, garlic, cilantro, salt, and lime juice. Serve immediately or store in refrigerator.
Layer chips with beans and cheese. Microwave until cheese melts. Top with jalapeños, sour cream, guacamole, and salsa. Garnish with cilantro. Serve immediately.
Warm tortillas. Fill with chicken and roll. Place in baking dish. Cover with sauce and cheese. Bake at 375°F for 15 minutes. Top with sour cream and cilantro.
Spread beans on tostada shells. Top with chicken, lettuce, tomato, and cheese. Add sour cream and cilantro. Serve immediately.
Boil water, butter, and salt. Add flour and stir until smooth. Beat in eggs. Pipe into hot oil and fry until golden. Roll in cinnamon sugar. Serve hot.
Cook pork in broth for 15 minutes. Add hominy, onion, garlic, and spices. Simmer for 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with toppings.

ingredients: Sour cream and salsa for serving
Mexican.cooking_instructions: Fill tortillas with chicken and cheese. Roll tightly. Fry until golden and crispy. Serve with sour cream and salsa.
Warm sope shells. Spread with beans. Top with chicken, lettuce, tomato, and cheese. Add sour cream. Serve immediately.
Split rolls and toast. Spread with beans. Top with cheese. Broil until cheese melts. Add pico de gallo and cilantro. Serve hot.
Heat salsa verde. Add tortilla chips and chicken. Cook for 3 minutes. Top with cheese, sour cream, and cilantro. Serve immediately.
Warm gordita shells. Fill with beans, beef, lettuce, tomato, and cheese. Top with sour cream. Serve immediately.
Spread masa on wrappers. Add chicken and sauce. Wrap tightly. Steam for 15 minutes. Top with cheese and serve.
Cook tripe in broth for 20 minutes. Add hominy, onion, garlic, and oregano. Simmer for 10 minutes. Season with salt and pepper. Serve with lime wedges.
Blend fruit with water, sugar, and lime juice. Strain and chill. Serve over ice.
Blend fruit with water, sugar, and lime juice. Pour into molds. Freeze for 4 hours. Serve frozen.
Warm tortillas. Mix beans with rice, tomatoes, bell peppers, and cumin. Add avocado and lettuce. Roll tightly and cut into bite-sized pieces.
Mexican.chef_tips: Use colorful vegetables for visual appeal. Make tight rolls for easy eating. Perfect for vegan kids.
Mexican.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange burrito pieces in bento box with salsa on the side.

Mexican.cooking_instructions: Heat oil in skillet. Place one tortilla, add chicken, cheese, and vegetables. Top with second tortilla. Cook until golden brown and cheese melts.
Mexican.chef_tips: Use gluten-free tortillas. Make small quesadillas for easy eating. Perfect for gluten-free diet.
Mexican.lunchbox_presentation: Cut into triangles and arrange in bento box with guacamole on the side.

Mexican.cooking_instructions: Mash avocado with lime juice. Mix with tomatoes, onion, garlic, cilantro, and cumin. Season with salt. Serve in small cups.
Mexican.chef_tips: Use fresh avocado for best taste. Make colorful guacamole for appeal. Perfect for dairy-free kids.
Mexican.lunchbox_presentation: Serve in small cups in bento box with tortilla chips on the side.

Mexican.cooking_instructions: Boil water with oil and salt. Add flour and stir until smooth. Pipe into hot oil. Fry until golden brown. Roll in cinnamon sugar.
Mexican.chef_tips: Use piping bag for easy shaping. Make small churros for easy eating. Perfect for egg-free diet.
Mexican.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange churros in bento box with chocolate sauce on the side.

Mexican.cooking_instructions: Mix lettuce with beans, vegetables, and taco seasoning. Add lime juice and toss. Top with tortilla chips.
Mexican.chef_tips: Use colorful vegetables for visual appeal. Make fresh salad for best taste. Perfect for vegan kids.
Mexican.lunchbox_presentation: Serve in bento box with fresh cilantro on top.

Mexican.cooking_instructions: Season fish with taco seasoning. Cook in olive oil until done. Warm tortillas. Fill with fish, cabbage, tomatoes, and onion. Drizzle with lime juice.
Mexican.chef_tips: Use gluten-free tortillas. Make mild seasoning for kids. Perfect for gluten-free diet.
Mexican.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange tacos in bento box with lime wedges on the side.

Mexican.cooking_instructions: Soak rice in water for 30 minutes. Blend with sugar, vanilla, and cinnamon. Strain and add coconut milk. Serve over ice.
Mexican.chef_tips: Use coconut milk for dairy-free version. Make sweet and refreshing. Perfect for dairy-free kids.
Mexican.lunchbox_presentation: Serve in insulated bottle in lunchbox.

Mexican.cooking_instructions: Mix masa with broth, oil, baking powder, and salt. Spread on corn husks. Add beans and vegetables. Wrap and steam for 20-25 minutes.
Mexican.chef_tips: Use fresh masa for best taste. Make small tamales for easy eating. Perfect for egg-free diet.
Mexican.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange tamales in bento box with salsa on the side.

Mexican.cooking_instructions: Sauté vegetables with taco seasoning. Fill tortillas with beans and vegetables. Roll and place in baking dish. Top with sauce and cheese. Bake at 375°F for 15-20 minutes.
Mexican.chef_tips: Use vegan cheese for melting. Make mild sauce for kids. Perfect for vegan kids.
Mexican.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange enchiladas in bento box with fresh cilantro on top.

Mexican.cooking_instructions: Sauté chicken and vegetables in olive oil with fajita seasoning. Warm tortillas. Serve with lettuce and tomatoes.
Mexican.chef_tips: Use gluten-free tortillas. Make mild seasoning for kids. Perfect for gluten-free diet.
Mexican.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange fajitas in bento box with lime wedges on the side.

Mexican.cooking_instructions: Mix coconut milk with sugar, egg, and vanilla. Pour into ramekin. Bake in water bath at 350°F for 25-30 minutes. Top with caramel sauce and cinnamon.
Mexican.chef_tips: Use coconut milk for dairy-free version. Make small portions for easy eating. Perfect for dairy-free kids.
Mexican.lunchbox_presentation: Serve in small bowls in bento box with fresh fruit on the side.

Mexican.cooking_instructions: Heat oil in skillet. Add tortilla chips and salsa. Cook until chips are soft. Top with cheese, onions, and cilantro. Serve with sour cream.
Mexican.chef_tips: Use mild salsa for kids. Make soft chips for easy eating. Perfect for egg-free diet.
Mexican.lunchbox_presentation: Serve in bento box with fresh cilantro on top.

Mexican.cooking_instructions: Sauté onions and garlic. Add hominy, tomatoes, broth, and spices. Simmer for 15-20 minutes. Top with cilantro and serve with lime wedges.
Mexican.chef_tips: Use mild spices for kids. Make colorful soup for appeal. Perfect for vegan kids.
Mexican.lunchbox_presentation: Serve in bento box with fresh cilantro and lime wedges on the side.

Mexican.cooking_instructions: Grill corn until charred. Brush with mayonnaise. Sprinkle with cheese, chili powder, and cilantro. Drizzle with lime juice.
Mexican.chef_tips: Use mild chili powder for kids. Make colorful elote for appeal. Perfect for gluten-free diet.
Mexican.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange elote in bento box with lime wedges on the side.

Mexican.cooking_instructions: Mix flour, sugar, baking powder, and salt. Add coconut oil, almond milk, and vanilla. Bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes. Soak with coconut milk and oat milk mixture.
Mexican.chef_tips: Use coconut milk for dairy-free version. Make small cakes for easy eating. Perfect for dairy-free kids.
Mexican.lunchbox_presentation: Arrange cake pieces in bento box with fresh fruit on the side.
